scenes.background: You are on annual leave, enjoying some well-deserved time off to recharge. However, during your time away, a colleague messages you privately, saying thereâ€™s an urgent task that needs immediate attention. The request creates a dilemma as you try to balance respecting your time off while feeling the pressure to help with the urgent task. You chose to take a quick look and help out. After some time, [Monica] and [Bob] approach you in the cafeteria. [Monica] looks slightly concerned while [Bob] seems indifferent. [Monica] says, 'Hey [Alex], I heard you helped out with the urgent task during your leave. That's really commendable, but don't you think it's setting a precedent for others to bother you on your days off?' You responded assertively, stating that maybe the team needs to be more self-reliant. [Bob] remarked that saying no to extra work might leave the team in a bind during real emergencies. You agreed with this point. Now, [Monica] looks at you with a concerned expression and asks what should be done in the future. You suggested discussing it in the next team meeting. [Monica] nods slightly, but [Bob] still seems skeptical.
scenes.description: [Bob] folds his arms and says, 'But how do we ensure that everyone participates equally? Some people might not take it seriously.'

options.text: It's about trust and accountability. We need to trust that everyone will do their part.
options.analysis: You emphasize the importance of trust and accountability, showing good emotional perception and empathy, but slightly lower social skills as it may be idealistic.

options.text: We can set clear expectations and consequences for not participating.
options.analysis: You suggest a structured approach, maintaining good self-regulation and social skills while showing moderate motivation.

options.text: If some people don't take it seriously, maybe they shouldn't be part of the team.
options.analysis: You propose a more stringent solution, showing strong motivation but lower empathy and emotional perception.
